author: Unreal Engine
description:
How does Epic Games’ Technical Developer Relations team profile games? 

Watch this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm and learn our optimization methodology as we dig deep into a real-world game, graciously shared by its developers. 

You'll see exactly how we profile, what problems we find, and how we’d go about solving them.

Whether you're shipping your first indie title or scaling a AAA production, you'll come away with actionable insights and a deeper understanding of how to think like Epic’s Technical Developer Relations team.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#GameProfiling, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Profiling with Purpose: Performance Lessons from a Real Unreal Project | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, Erizos Studio showcases the work it’s doing for Danish broadcaster TV2 Fyn with Unreal Engine. 

TV2 Fyn is going all-in on Unreal Engine-powered infrastructure for its broadcast graphics. For the first time, Unreal Engine will be used for all graphics required, from virtual 3D to 2D overlays. 

This talk sees Erizos Studio demonstrate a proven workflow that enables TV2 Fyn to standardize on a single render platform: a vanilla instance of Unreal Engine. 

Watch to find out how this is a strategic move for TV2 Fyn, both to enhance their current broadcast quality and also enable future opportunities where the content is delivered to a multi-platform audience.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#BroadcastGraphics, #MotionDesign, #2DOverlays, #TV2Fyn, #ErizosStudio, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Putting Unreal Engine at the Heart of Live News | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
MASTER UE5 CINEMATIC WORKFLOW: Start your professional animation journey by exploring the full Unreal Engine 5 project structure, developed by Agora Studio. Learn how cinematic production files are organized, from the animatic to the final sequence. Gain hands-on experience adjusting the editing and pace of the master level sequence clips (like a video editor), while learning crucial production tips for organization and safe iteration practices (duplication/revision control)

Dive under the hood of a complete animation pipeline: from rigging and keyframe animation to lighting, visual effects, and rendering—all managed directly in UE5.
►Download the A-COM Animation Sample here: https://epic.gm/agora-animation-sample

► Check out Sir Wade's channel for more Animation Tutorials and UE5 workflows: https://www.youtube.com/@SirWade/
► Sir Wade's Courses: https://courses.sirwade.com

#Animation, #ACOMAnimaticSample, #UnrealEngine5.6, #AgoraStudio
title: Unreal Engine 5: Animation Cinematic Production Overview

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm to discover how Unreal Engine’s Substrate material system transforms the way artists create and control surface shading. 

This session dives into the new physically based model, showcases the method through which Substrate produces more flexible materials with greater visual fidelity, and provides practical tips for transitioning from legacy materials with confidence.

We explore how Substrate replaces the traditional shading model with a more physically accurate node-based system, looking at the way the new workflow separates material logic from surface description, enabling advanced layering, blending, and interaction between materials that was not possible with legacy models.

We also dive into the benefits for art teams; practical tips for converting legacy materials to Substrate; common pitfalls and best practices; and how adopting Substrate will future-proof your pipeline.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.co
title: Everything You Wanted to Know About Substrate(But Are Too Afraid to Ask)| Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
